sub_topic: Solving systems of linear equations with noisy data
message_1:
Given the following system of linear equations with noisy data:

\begin{align}
3x - 2y + z &= 9.7 \\
2x + y + 4z &= 21.1 \\
5x - 3y - 2z &= 4.9 \\
\end{align}

Solve for the values of $x$, $y$, and $z$.
message_2:
To solve the system of linear equations, we can use the Gaussian elimination method. First, we write the augmented matrix for the given system:

$$
\left[\begin{array}{ccc|c}
3 & -2 & 1 & 9.7 \\
2 & 1 & 4 & 21.1 \\
5 & -3 & -2 & 4.9 \\
\end{array}\right]
$$

Now, we perform row operations to get the matrix in row-echelon form:

1. Swap Row 1 and Row 2:

$$
\left[\begin{array}{ccc|c}
2 & 1 & 4 & 21.1 \\
3 & -2 & 1 & 9.7 \\
5 & -3 & -2 & 4.9 \\
\end{array}\right]
$$

2. Replace Row 2 with (-3/2) * Row 1 + Row 2:

$$
\left[\begin{array}{ccc|c}
2 & 1 & 4 & 21.1 \\
0 & -4 & -5 & -22.65 \\
5 & -3 & -2 & 4.9 \\
\end{array}\right]
$$

3. Replace Row 3 with (-5/2) * Row 1 + Row 3:

$$
\left[\begin{array}{ccc|c}
2 & 1 & 4 & 21.1 \\
0 & -4 & -5 & -22.65 \\
0 & -5 & -12 & -41.35 \\
\end{array}\right]
$$

4. Divide Row 2 by -4:

$$
\left[\begin{array}{ccc|c}
2 & 1 & 4 & 21.1 \\
0 & 1 & 5/4 & 5.6625 \\
0 & -5 & -12 & -41.35 \\
\end{array}\right]
$$

5. Replace Row 3 with 5 * Row 2 + Row 3:

$$
\left[\begin{array}{ccc|c}
2 & 1 & 4 & 21.1 \\
0 & 1 & 5/4 & 5.6625 \\
0 & 0 & -1 & -9.975 \\
\end{array}\right]
$$

Now, we have the matrix in row-echelon form. We can use back-substitution to find the values of $x$, $y$, and $z$:

1. Divide Row 3 by -1:

$$
z = 9.975
$$

2. Replace Row 2 with Row 2 - (5/4) * Row 3:

$$
y = 5.6625 - (5/4)(9.975) \approx -1.99375
$$

3. Replace Row 1 with Row 1 - 4 * Row 3 - Row 2:

$$
x = (21.1 - 4(9.975) - (-1.99375))/2 \approx 1.00625
$$

So, the approximate values of $x$, $y$, and $z$ are:

$$
x \approx 1.00625 \\
y \approx -1.99375 \\
z \approx 9.975 \\
$$
